Other countries had to build and maintain Maginot lines, the US had the Atlantic and the Pacific oceans from the start. All wars you fought took place outside, leaving your economic heartland intact. This made intervening in WWI and WWII much easier and less painful.

 
 The wars weren't caused by the US. WWI was a result of wacky royal marriages and EU secret treaties. WWII was because the French and English forced (against US wishes) an untenable peace on what became the AXIS. So our blood and our treasure were 'donated' to solve the problems others caused. Its not the scale that even matters, its that we did it at all! We didn't fight here, because we didn't start the wars. Then after it was over, we spent scads of money, REBUILDING our enemies! We've even made it possible for Japan to bloom, since they've not needed to spend a dime on defense.
 
 
 
In my personal view: I used to love the US. However, more and more, the US have switched from being "a power for good" to being an egoist. Right now, the US is at it's lowest. It has squandered all the moral capital it had gained in the past and incurred a mighty big debt. It turned from being a big friendly uncle into a big bossy bully.
 
 The US started doing less and less good and more and more harm. Like destroying what little authority the UN and international law had. That's easy for the US to do, with the biggest military around. But many states don't and UN authority and acceptance of international law were all they had.

 
 We are finally getting tired of putting up with the propaganda echoing around the world. We'd like nothing more than for all countries to be democratic, free, and every one concentrating on making money, not war.
 
 
 
In the end: the US is drunk on power, and needs to sober up soon. Then, it can rebuild its integrity.
 
 And I hope it does. I believe in one humanity above individual states and divisiveness is a bad thing.

 
 
 
 If power was the aim, why do we always give the land back? Hell even Vietnam was lost because our country wouldn't attack the north, only try to protect the south. Why do we go and waste all the money and blood, just to try to turn the country back to its people? If we were power mad, why don't we really fight? Why risk soldiers' lives when a smart (or not so smart) bomb would do? Why give N. Korea fuel instead of bombing? We go out of our way, at great expense, to preserve life when possible and preserve sovereignty and rights even of our enemies.
